quote: ... Starfleet feels it has no other    choice... the Federation is here at    the invitation of the Bajoran    provisional government...
No more provisional government... no    more invitation.

Governments can break off relations    with an edict.  It's not so easy    when it comes down to our level.     Lieutenant Bilecki here is engaged    to a young man from Bajor...    (she acknowledges     sadly)   Ensign Kelly's daughter and a Bajoran    girl worked together on a prize-   winning science fair project...       All of us who've served on this    station for the past year have made    Bajoran friends; we've come to care    about what happens to these people.
I know I do.  So, I've decided to    stay.    (continuing over     murmuring reactions     from the crowd)   Just to make sure the "evacuation    is... conducted properly"...
You'll be needing someone to oversee    the inventory process, sir...
Packing up all my medical supplies    is going to take quite a long time,    Commander...
Count me in, Commander... I'm    staying... I'll be here... You can    count on me, sir...

Before you volunteer too quickly,    understand what you're in for.  We'll    be trying to delay the takeover of    the station as long as possible...    hopefully as long as it takes to    expose the Cardassian involvement in    all this.  It won't be easy.  These    Bajoran assault forces have been    told the Federation is their blood    enemy.  Jaro and The Circle would    love nothing better than to present    my head... and yours... to the Chamber    of Ministers.  This is the last chance    to leave here in one piece.  Some of    you have families.  Some of you are    on temporary assignment.  I wouldn't    blame anyone for getting out now    while you can.  I mean that.
Anyone who wants to evacuate is    dismissed.

Non-Bajorans won't be safe here...    our families, children have to be    evacuated... I'm sure many of the    Bajorans who have worked with us    will want to leave too.  There's a    lot to get done.  The assault vessels    will be here in less than five hours.       Dismissed.
Hundreds of people to evacuate and    only three tiny runabouts available.     Do you know what that means?
It... it means... a lot of people    will be left behind... tragic, yes,    brother... your compassion never    ceases to amaze me...
It means we're gonna make a fortune...
We are... ?
People will pay anything for a seat    on those ships...
You can't make me...       I won't sell my seat...
Rom...
... No, I won't stay and be killed    just to fill your pockets...
... Rom, do you actually believe I    would sacrifice my own brother's    life for personal profit?
It would have to be the deal of a    lifetime.
Yeah, my lifetime.
Listen to me -- we're both going to    escape... but our bags will be packed    with all the gold-pressed latinum we    can carry...
Nog!
I've been looking all over for you.
What ship you on?
Rio Grande.
I'm on the Ganges.
It'll be okay... we'll see each other    at the Hanolan colony in a few days...
That's not where I'm going.
But my dad told me...
My ship's going to the Korat system...    I guess that's where they're taking    the Starfleet families...
This'll be over in no time... we'll    be back in school driving Mrs. O'Brien    crazy again in a few days...
Just when I think I've found a new    home, made a new friend... it always    seems like I gotta leave.
Hey, Hew-man...
Cut it out...
Has there ever been one of your kind    and one of mine who were better    friends?
Never.
If our fathers couldn't break us up,    no stupid coupe day... coupe dey...
... coup d'etat... it's French...
... No stupid French thing will    either... we'll see each other    again... soon... and that's a    promise.
Mister Sisko, Nog...
This is no time to be fooling    around... get yourselves wherever    you're supposed to be...
Is that everything?
Sure.
Keiko.  Don't leave like this.
Like what?
I don't have any choice.
Don't you?
He needs me.
We don't?
We can't let the bloody Cardies have    the wormhole.
They can have the whole Gamma Quadrant    for all I care.
Miles, come with us.
Where are we going?
On a ride, sweetheart...
Are you coming too, Daddy?
Soon, baby.  I'll come as soon as I    can.
I'll walk you to the airlock.
I've scanned every subspace    communication window to find a    frequency to Bajor... they've got    them completely jammed.

quote: Then, we have no choice.  We'll have    to take the proof to the Chamber of    Ministers...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Jaro's forces will be scanning for    any incoming vessels...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: A runabout could handle a Bajoran    patrol... unfortunately I don't have    one to give you...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: The Lunar Five base?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: You think there might still be a    ship there?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: We managed to get a few sub-impulse    raiders underground before the    Cardassians hit us...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Can one of the evacuation vessels    take a detour and drop me off?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: (anticipating her     plan)   What if you get there and those    raiders won't fly?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Then, I'll just have to wait to hear    from you, I guess...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: You may be waiting a long time.
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Dax, any of your former hosts have    experience with sub-impulse thruster    configurations...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Yeah... Tobin Dax...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Tobin?  I don't think I've heard of    that one...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: My second host... barely a sex life    and no imagination, but he knew phase    coil inverters like no one else.
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Major Kira could use his experience    today.
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: I have no time for this foolishness!     I still have to pack!
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: What's the problem?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: He's been brokering seats on the    evacuation vessels...
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Where did you get more than one    seat?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: (amused, the     professional ticket     broker)   Everybody always asks the brokers
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: I've got over two hundred people who    want to get off this station.  Where    did you get more seats?
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: A few trades... a person here or    there who changed his mind about    leaving at the sight of a reasonable    stipend...

quote: Bashir to Commander Sisko.
scene: 6    INT. OPS - CLOSE ON AN OKUDAGRAM (VPB)

quote: Go ahead.

quote: We're having a bit of a panic at the    airlocks, sir... far more passengers    than we can handle have shown up...    they all claim to have made    arrangements to leave...
I may have overbooked slightly...
I'm on my way.
... It's an accepted Ferengi transit    practice... I feel perfectly    justified...
I have complete faith in Commander    Sisko's ability to straighten this    out...
I'll pass that on.  He'll be so    pleased to have your confidence.
As I'm no longer needed, my brother's    waiting for me on the ship...    (he moves to the     Turbolift)   Hey Odo, you'll miss me... you know    you will... say it...
I'll miss you, Quark.
You said it!
I'll miss the aggravation.  The petty    theft.  The bad manners...
Odo...
Take care of yourself.
You can't leave us here... we have    to get out... I have a right to be    on that ship... I've paid for a seat    on that ship... Let us on!
You can't leave us here... we have    to get out... I have a right to be    on that ship... I've paid for a seat    on that ship... Let us on!
There isn't room for everyone...    don't you understand... We have to    get the children and families and    non-Bajorans...
Where are you running to?  This is    Bajor.  We're Bajorans.  We fought a    war to regain our homeland.  How can    you abandon it like frightened    Cardassian voles?
These ships are for our guests who    must leave because it's no longer    safe for them.  We're Bajorans.  I    say we stay and solve our problems    together.  Are you willing to join    me?
The moment the passenger lists are    confirmed, I want these ships out of    here...
They're almost ready to go sir...    the Rio Grande is full, so is the    Orinoco.
Get them launched...
Aye, sir...
Ready?
I've been thinking.
Yeah?
I really think it'd be better if I    stayed.
I don't want anything to happen to    you.
That makes two of us.
What's this?
A letter I wrote you.
A letter?
Just some things.
I'll read it as soon as I get on the    ship.
Wait a while.
See you in a coupla weeks.
That's everyone...
Sisko to Ganges.  Proceed with launch.
Acknowledged.  Good luck, Commander.     Kira out.
No!  Wait!
My ship... the Rio Grande... my    brother's on it -- he has my ticket...
Sir, that ship was full... I checked    the list myself, Quark's name wasn't    on it... I did see Rom go on board...    he was with one of the dabo girls...
Dabo girl... what?!
Looks like he sold your seat, Quark.
No, you don't understand... I can't    stay here... I'll be hung... call    the ships back... I'll pay anyone    five bars of gold press latinum for    a seat... all right ten... twenty...
Clear.
No resistance at all.  Minister Jaro's    prediction was correct... the    Federation has tucked its tail between    its legs...
Where are the Bajoran officers who    supported Starfleet... and where's    Li Nalas?
Perhaps they knew this old station    could never withstand a siege so    they abandoned it with Starfleet.
The most strategic position in the    entire sector... at the mouth of the    wormhole... Had I been the Federation    commander, I would not have abandoned    it so easily.
Can you believe... about a year ago,    I was living in a camp like this    only not quite so nice.
(unhappily shaking     off the cobwebs)   Have I mentioned how allergic Trills    are to insect bites?
Really?
The biochemical connections between    the host and symbiont can't tolerate    the...    (interrupting herself,     startled)   Is that a spider or a dog?
Palukoo.  The Bajoran moons are    full of them.
I suppose they became your pets and    you all sang songs about them around    the campfire.
No, we ate them.
There it is...
You're sure this is supposed to fly?
I've been in a lot worse.
I guess the Bajoran resistance must    have had a lot of short pilots.
No, just short engineers.  They were    always building these things without    thinking.
Encouraging.
Bend your knees, you'll fit.
The real trick'll be to fire up these    thrusters after a year... it was    hard enough to get them running when    they were being used every day.
Oh, we'll get them fired up.  You    don't have to worry about that...
You're sure, huh...
Yep.  I have no intention of getting    stuck here...       ... eating palukoos.
We should advise Minister Jaro of    our success immediately.
You're too eager to receive his    plaudits, Colonel.       What's the status of the internal    security net... ?
Completely disabled, General...
(annoyed at the way     he's treated)   The Minister personally requested    that I inform him as soon as we...
Fine.  Go on, go on... call your    friend... use a secured frequency...
Scan the Operations Center for organic    material.
Organic... ?
The station's security chief is    apparently missing... the shape-   shifter... it's possible he left    with the evacuation ships... or    perhaps there's more here than meets    the eye...
Yes, sir...
Scan six times an hour at random    intervals... and advise all units to    be alert when they're...
(moving to Viewscreen     position)   Minister... I'm pleased to report    that we've encountered no resistance    so far...
Good news... then the Federation has    withdrawn...
We monitored the evacuation of three    vessels several hours ago...
When I announce that we've secured    the station, it will certainly impact    the...
Minister, I urge caution... the battle    for this station has not even begun    yet...
Do you expect the enemy to return,    General?
I'm not convinced they ever left.
The internal security net has been    sabotaged... we have no way to track    movements of anyone on board... which    suggests that someone didn't want to    be easily found.
Kira?
Perhaps.  She is unaccounted for.     So is Security Chief Odo.  So is Li    Nalas.
You're right.  Li would never have    abandoned Bajor... he must still be    there...
For that matter, Starfleet might    have even left a contingent on    board...
I'll be organizing search parties.
Let me re-emphasize that you are to    take every necessary step to keep Li    Nalas alive.  Dead, he's a martyr.     Alive, he seals our victory.
Understood.
Once you have him, Li will see the    wisdom of giving you his support.
I'll offer him anything he wants to    make sure he does...       Short of becoming the next Kai, of    course.
You have a unique ability to build a    consensus, Essa.  Bajor has been    waiting for a leader like you.
Leaders like us.
If I am so favored by the Vedek    Assembly.
You don't have to worry about that...    twenty-six hours after I'm sworn    into office, I'll direct the Vedek    Assembly to elect you Kai... and    together, we will rebuild Bajor.
You got it!
Don't turn them off... we'll never    get them going again!
Let's go!
Thank you, Tobin.
Come on, Dax!
The hell with it.  If it's gonna    fly, it's gonna fly.
Problem?
No.  Everything's... wonderful.
Ow.
The knees.
Listen to that sound... this brings    back some memories...
How did you ever win a war in these    things?
We were the insects, Lieutenant.     The Cardassians were just as allergic    as Trills.  Is the proximity system    working?
I think so.
Then let's see if I can get out of    here without bouncing off the walls...
You'll be playing right into their    hands.
If you're so convinced they're still    here, how can you sit and wait for    them to attack...
They have no interest in attacking...
How can you be so sure?
Because I understand military tactics.     They are vastly outnumbered.  If we    divide our forces...
Military tactics.  The great General.     You are nothing without Jaro's    support.  You could just as easily    be in prison today as in command of    this station.
Our priority is to get this station    running... once we do, finding them    will be easier.
The primary sensor array was    sabotaged, sir... as soon as we tested    it, the subnet shorted out...
You can let your engineers play with    the machines... I'm sending out search    parties...
Eat hearty... the replicators crash    in sixteen minutes... this'll have    to last awhile...
Combat rations, Chief?  Couldn't you    replicate something a little more    palatable?
You don't like combat rations?
A french onion soup would have been    nice...
Miracle of science, these little    rations... timed release formula of    all the nutrients the body needs for    three days.       I love 'em... only thing I miss about    the Cardassian front.
Sisko to all units.  You can thank    Chief of Operations Miles O'Brien    for the menu this afternoon...
You haven't made any friends, here,    Chief... or should I say, Chef...
Julian, I would expect you of all    people to appreciate the nutritional    value of combat rations...
Actually, in med school, I designed    an incredible candy bar that was far    superior in food value...
Am I the only one who doesn't find    this funny... ?
Odo to Sisko...
Go ahead...
Stand by.
A six-man unit is about to begin a    search of the cargo deck...
That puts them closest to me,    Commander.
Stand by, Doctor.
Maybe we ought to send him someone    with experience... someone who can    run the show like Li...
No, I need Li here with us.       All right, Doctor... move your unit    to cargo bay six, you know what to    do... and let me re-emphasize -- use    deadly force only if absolutely    necessary.
Aye, sir... we're on our way...
Happy hunting.  I'll be here thinking    of you.
I wouldn't get too close to that...    it's a thorium isotope...
Prolonged exposure can have nasty    consequences.
Bashir to Sisko.
Go ahead.
Mission accomplished.
We have our first six prisoners of    war.
Preparing to establish a high altitude    orbit of Bajor...
Navigational sensors aren't    functioning...
No problem...
No problem?  Big problem.  Without    navigational sensors...
... we'll have to fly by the seat of    our pants.
Great.  Seat of the pants technology.
You Starfleet types depend too much    on gadgets and gizmos... you lose    your natural instincts for survival...
My natural instincts for survival    told me not to climb aboard this    thing... I'd say they were functioning    pretty well...
I know the terrain of Bajor... we    ought to be able to recognize a    landing site by...
What the hell was that?
I have no idea... None of the sensors    are...
Someone's firing at us... initiating    evasive maneuvers...
I'm reading the E-M signature of an    impulse engine...
Let's see what we're dealing with...
Welcoming committee from Jaro...
We'll never outrun them in this...
You're right... we've gotta even the    match...
How do you intend to do that?
(as she furiously     presses panels)   New playing field.  I'm taking us    down into the atmosphere.  They won't    be able to use their impulse engines    down there.
If they want a fight... they'll have    to fight on our terms...
O'Brien to Sisko.  They've got us    pinned down in here...
On our way, Chief...
Now!
All right.  They've gone to thrusters.     That evens things up a little.
If you consider two against one    "even."
There is one problem.
One?
The guys flying those ships?
Yeah...
Used to be the guys flying these    ships.
Test the phaser banks.
Full power.
Good.
Not so good.  The phaser locks are    dead.  There's no way to aim.
Sure there is.
I know.  I know.  Seat of the pants...
With your eyes, Lieutenant... not    your... pants.  Just point at them    and fire.
You fly.  I'll shoot.
Hang on.
Where the hell's the other one?
I think we found him.
Thruster power is falling...
They must've hit a plasma conduit...
Is there any fire gear?
Check under the seat.
I think I've got something.
That's it?
That's it.
Got any other ideas?
Yeah.  We could crash.
Is that the best you can come up    with?
'Fraid it is.
(sighs, okay here we     go)   Might as well jettison the plasma    tank.  The thrusters are gone.
Plasma tank ejected... can you see    any openings where we can put down?
Three kilometers ahead at two    o'clock...
Anything a little closer?
How much closer?
How about... right here.
Sir, up here... one of the Ferengi's    holosuites is in use...
Override it manually.
Don't try it.
Get their weapons.
This is Commander Benjamin Sisko.
Please listen very carefully.  The    Cardassians are supplying the weapons    for this coup...
Ridiculous.  No Bajoran would ever    accept help from them.
Jaro doesn't know -- The Cardassians    are using the Kressari to deliver    the weapons to The Circle.
That is a Federation lie.

Tell General Krim that proof is on    its way to Bajor... once this evidence    is presented, the coup will end...    we don't want to fight you, or hurt    anyone...       Your officers will be our guests for    awhile.  I hope they won't mind    Starfleet combat rations.
I was taken prisoner... the Federation    is behind all this... Sisko spoke to    me...
(reacts, to himself,     admiring)   So, Commander, you didn't abandon    your post after all.       What did he say?
Nothing of consequence.
Why did he let you go?
I promised them amnesty...    (Krim reacts, this     doesn't sound at all     right)   A promise I have no intention of    keeping.
General, the security net is back on    line.
Scan for their communication devices.
Not picking up a thing, sir.
Then they must be in a shielded    location...
The Cardassians used duranium    composite to shield all the    conduits...
Then that's where we'll find Commander    Sisko...
They've found the raider and now    they're spreading out... we can't    stay here...
I'll slow you down.  The only thing    that's important now is to get the    evidence to the provisional    government.
It'd be a lot more convincing if it    came from you...
The evidence speaks for itself.     You've got to leave me.  That's an    order, Lieutenant.
The Federation officially left Bajor    yesterday.  You're not my commanding    officer anymore.
I can't walk...
Sure you can, come on...
... you're being a fool, Dax...
... And don't speak to your elders    that way...
Odo to Sisko.  I hope you're not    still on level five...
No, we're on three... why?
Because they're about to fill the    conduits with anesthizine gas...    starting with level five...
Chief?
Good idea.  Kind of thing I might've    come up with.  We've got to get out    of here and soon.
We should have heard something from    Dax and Kira by now...
If they didn't make it, we're all    fighting for a lost cause here...
We still have an ace in the hole.
Me...
Mister O'Brien, get the units ready    to move out.
Aye, sir...
Jaro's plan depends on the military's    support... without it, the coup fails.
You think I can sway the Generals...

Right now, I'm only concerned with    one General... The one that's here...    he's picked the wrong side and we've    got to convince him of that...    (off Li's doubtful     look, evenly)   Would he rather follow a politician...    or Bajor's greatest war hero...
I've done everything I can to help.     I would die for my people but...
Sure you would.  Dying gets you off    the hook.  Question is -- are you    willing to live for your people?     Live the role they want you to play.     That's what they need from you right    now.
Kira... you're safe... you're at the    monastery...
(trying to regain     composure)   How did I... the last thing I    remember...
The entire city saw your ship go    down... the searchers that found you    were from my order...
Dax... ?
She's fine... she's changing    clothes...
We've got to get to the Chamber of    Ministers... the Cardassians...
I know.  Lieutenant Dax told me.
Careful, you've just had a broken    hip mended...
How long have I been here?
Six hours.
Six hours... we have to...
Good, you're up... put this on...
Why are we...
It's the only way we can get to the    Chamber of Ministers...
Members of religious orders are the    only ones who can travel safely in    the streets... I'm going to escort    you...
No.  We have to go alone, Bareil...    I can't be responsible for your    safety...
Of course you can't.  But I can be    responsible for yours.  Please don't    argue.
So what do you think... ?
Think?
The nose?
It's... flattering.
I'm thinking of keeping it.
Quark, leave it!
I can't leave it.  It's all that I    am.  My personal mementos, my family    album...
It's filled with gold-pressed latinum    and you know it.
Who told you!
Your mother did.  The day you were    born.
Never make fun of a Ferengi's mother.     Rule of Acquisition number thirty-   one.
Sisko to Bashir.
We're in position.
My unit's stationed above Airlock    Fourteen, awaiting your signal.
You've got it.  Just make as much    noise as you can before you surrender,    Doctor.
We'll make them think there are two    hundred of us instead of twenty,    sir.  Bashir out.       Twenty-one.  Come on.  Now!
Fine.  Fine.  I'm coming.
Proceed with level three...
General, the enemy has attacked our    position at airlock fourteen...
They've attacked?
We must have flushed them out...    Seal all airlocks, lock all docking    clamps...       This is Colonel Day.  All security    units to airlock fourteen.
Let me see what's going on down    there...
Surveillance cameras have been    sabotaged...
How many of our officers are stationed    by that airlock... ?
Four, sir.
Our four men seem to be doing a    remarkable job of holding them off...    unless...
Sir, sensors are reading organic    material in this room...
Here...
The shape-shifter... ?
Nossir.  Some kind of petroleum    jelly...       The organic readings seem to have    disappeared...
This is Colonel Day.  The enemy forces    at airlock fourteen have surrendered.     We've taken several prisoners.
(trying to measure     all this)   Bring them to me for questioning.
Please don't resist, General.  We    have no wish to use deadly force.
My name is Li Nalas.  Perhaps you've    heard of me.
Stop that woman... guards!
What is this blasphemy...
I am Major Kira Nerys and I've come    with proof that Cardassians are behind    Minister Jaro's attempt to take    control of the government.

Major Kira has long been an outspoken    opponent of the provisional    government, of reason and progress    and finally now of me.  I am honored    to be included, Major.    (signalling to the     guards to remove her)   But I have no intention of allowing    you to disrupt the orderly transition    of power with your wild charges...

This is a manifest padd from a    Kressari vessel.  It bears the    thumbscan of the Cardassian Gul who    transferred weapons to that ship.     Those weapons were taken by the    Kressari to The Circle.
This coup will deliver Bajor back    into the hands of its greatest enemy.     Are you willing to live under    Cardassian rule again?
I assure you there is nothing to    these accusations...
Then you should have no objection to    an inspection of this manifest,    Minister...
Of course not...
We will... adjourn for the time being    and let me say that I completely    support this investigation and intend    to fully cooperate with...
Major Kira... Major Kira... may I    have a word with you... Major... do    you have any details on the contents    of this manifest... are you certain    the Cardassians are involved?
Colonel, you deliberately withheld    information that was to be    communicated to me...
Information... ?
Regarding the Cardassians...
Lies... that's all they were...
Would you stake your life on that?
You may want to consult your friend    Minister Jaro before answering...    we've been told the Chamber is in    recess while evidence of Cardassian    involvement is being examined.
The Circle... is broken, Colonel.

I'm returning to the surface    immediately to consult with the    Ministers.  I expect that I will be    asked to resign.       Commander, since the provisional    government has prevailed, I believe    it is appropriate to return command    of this station to Starfleet.       Well fought, sir.
No...
Commander!
Off the hook... after all...

Somehow, you figured now that he was    back, things would be better, you    know, he'd find a way to make them    better... because he was a man who    could do that... a great man... I    wish I knew where we could find others    like him...
There are heroes all over Bajor,    Major... I'm standing with one...
Sorry, I just don't feel like    celebrating tonight.  Excuse me.
Sir, can I ask you something?
Sure, Chief.
About Li Nalas.
Uh huh...

Listening to Kira talk about all he    was, all he did, all he was gonna    do... I mean she made him sound larger    than life... like he was some kind    of military genius... but the Li    Nalas I fought with...
